extDescription.message: Clean up old messages to reduce clutter and improve performance, helping ChatGPT run more smoothly.

tipHideEffect.message: Reduces screen clutter; can be restored anytime via the top button

tipHideDetail.message:
Messages will be hidden from the page but still remain in the DOM.
Interactions are temporarily disabled (inert, aria-hidden), with styles (HIDDEN, INERT) applied as markers.
When needed, you can bring them back instantly with the “Show previous” button, no reloading required.
This method only hides the view and interaction — the messages and their events are still there, continuing to use some resources.

tipDeleteMain.message: Excess messages will be cleared from the page

tipDeleteEffect.message: Frees memory and system resources; suited for long and heavy conversations

tipDeleteDetail.message:
Messages, along with their related data and event bindings, will be completely removed from the DOM (via Element.remove()).
They no longer occupy any browser DOM resources.
For large cleanups, removal runs in chunks during idle time to reduce visible lag.
This mode only affects the webpage content and does not touch server or account data.
If a conversation grows too large, performance issues may still occur due to ChatGPT’s own design.

tipReload.message: After switching modes, refreshing the page is recommended for best results
